item.title: LLM text classification Shiny App (R)
item.dc:creator: Kaizhong (Mike) Mu
item.description:
Shiny App

Data Files

The app requires three data files:

  1. Original Data
  2. Human-Filled Data
  3. GPT-Filled Data

Shiny App Readme

The goal of this shiny app is to automatically report the comparison of AI vs Human performance in text classification for Private Equity (in Comparison: Human vs. GPT tab) and report the exploratory data analysis (in EDA: Human-filled Dataset tab).

This will enable you to no longer need to repeatedly write code/reports when trying various LLM models with human comparisons in the future. All you need to do is input three datasets: “Original Data” (100 entries randomly selected from the original dataset), “Human-Filled Data” (humans text classification), and “GPT-Filled Data” (AI text classification given prompts)

Presentation

Project Overview

The shiny app is designed to provide visualization for the health data science summer fellowship projects, supervised by Dr. Alyssa Bilinski. You could check the details of project from the presentation slides.

Direct Link to App

item.title: Simulation Study Shiny App (R)
item.dc:creator: Kaizhong (Mike) Mu
item.description:
Shiny App

SRB Simulation Study: This Shiny App is designed to show the simulation study results for my second research project under the mentorship of Dr. Ani Eloyan. Our simulation involves multiple parameters (e.g., rate of decline, baseline severity, sample size). Static plots can only capture a few pre-selected scenarios, failing to show the full picture. So, I developed an interactive Shiny app to explore any combination of parameters in real-time.

Project Details: The detail could check in A Bayesian Cognitive Change Method for Censored Longitudinal Data.

Direct Link to App
